title: CLAUDE.md
text: standard R package. Use common R package development commands: devtools::load_all() - Load package development devtools::document() - Generate documentation roxygen2 comments devtools::check() - Run R CMD check devtools::test() - Run tests (tests/ directory exists) devtools::install() - Install package locally

title: Call the Gradio backend — get_feedback_call
text: Function call Gradio backend LLM homework_name student answer.

title: Call the Gradio backend — get_feedback_call
text: homework_name Homework name format homeworkXqY X homework number Y question number. student_answer Student answer. container_name Name container.

title: Call the Gradio backend — get_feedback_call
text: feedback returned funky format Gradio's API supports streaming results get nice clean JSON. Instead get line text event status followed actual LLM \n " escaped something like following:

title: Call the Gradio backend — get_feedback_call
code:
feedback <- get_feedback_call(   homework_name = "homework1-q1",   student_answer = "give me the question",   container_name = "container_hostname_as_a_session_id" ) #> No encoding supplied: defaulting to UTF-8. feedback #> [1] "event: complete
data: ["**Feedback:** Your response does not address the question asked. You were required to visualize the distribution of population density from the `midwest` data frame and provide a narrative on the appropriateness of the binwidths used.\n\n- \u274c Code produces a histogram with binwidth 100. You did not provide any code or visualization.\n- \u274c Code produces a histogram with binwidth 1,000. You did not provide any code or visualization.\n- \u274c Code produces a histogram with binwidth 10,000. You did not provide any code or visualization.\n- \u274c Code produces a histogram with binwidth 100,000. You did not provide any code or visualization.\n- \u274c All plots have informative and human-readable titles and/or subtitles and axis labels. You did not create any plots or provide titles and labels.\n- \u274c Code style and readability: Line breaks after each +, proper indentation, spaces around = signs if they are present, and spaces after commas if they are present. No code was provided for evaluation.\n- \u274c Narrative mentions an appropriate binwidth (1000 or 10000). You did not provide a narrative.\n- \u274c Narrative states a well-articulated and accurate reason stated for the chosen binwidth. No narrative was provided.\n\nPlease attempt to answer the question by generating the required histograms and providing the expected narrative."]

"
